suncertify.db
Interface DBAccess

All Known Implementing Classes:
Data
public interface DBAccess

An interface implemented by classes that provide access to the contractor data store.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Gregory Biegel

Method Summary
 long createRecord(java.lang.String[] data)
          Creates a new record in the database (possibly reusing a deleted entry).
 void deleteRecord(long recNo, long lockCookie)
          Deletes a record, making the record number and associated disk storage available for reuse.
 long[] findByCriteria(java.lang.String[] criteria)
          Returns an array of record numbers that match the specified criteria.
 long lockRecord(long recNo)
          Locks a record so that it can only be updated or deleted by this client.
 java.lang.String[] readRecord(long recNo)
          Reads a record from the file storing the list of contractors.
 void unlock(long recNo, long cookie)
          Releases the lock on a record.
 void updateRecord(long recNo, java.lang.String[] data, long lockCookie)
          Modifies the fields of a record.
 

Method Detail

readRecord

public java.lang.String[] readRecord(long recNo)
                              throws RecordNotFoundException
Reads a record from the file storing the list of contractors.

Parameters:
recNo - the identifier of the record to read.
Returns:
an array holding the record fields.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - thrown if the record is not found.

updateRecord

public void updateRecord(long recNo,
                         java.lang.String[] data,
                         long lockCookie)
                  throws RecordNotFoundException,
                         java.lang.SecurityException
Modifies the fields of a record. The new value for field n appears in data[n].

Parameters:
recNo - the identifier of the record to modify.
data - an array containing the modified record fields.
lockCookie - the cookie with which the record was locked.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - thrown if the record is not found in the database.
java.lang.SecurityException - thrown if the record is locked with a cookie other than lockCookie.

deleteRecord

public void deleteRecord(long recNo,
                         long lockCookie)
                  throws RecordNotFoundException,
                         java.lang.SecurityException
Deletes a record, making the record number and associated disk storage available for reuse.

Parameters:
recNo - the identifier of the record to delete.
lockCookie - the cookie with which the record was locked.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - thrown if the record is not found in the database.
java.lang.SecurityException - thrown if the record is locked with a cookie other than lockCookie.

findByCriteria

public long[] findByCriteria(java.lang.String[] criteria)
Returns an array of record numbers that match the specified criteria. Field n in the database file is described by criteria[n]. A null value in criteria[n] matches any field value. A non-null value in criteria[n] matches any field value that begins with criteria[n]. (For example, "Fred" matches "Fred" or "Freddy".)

Parameters:
criteria - the array of criteria to search by.
Returns:
an array of record numbers that match the specified criteria.

createRecord

public long createRecord(java.lang.String[] data)
                  throws DuplicateKeyException
Creates a new record in the database (possibly reusing a deleted entry). Inserts the given data, and returns the record number of the new record.

Parameters:
data - the new record to insert.
Returns:
the identifier of the record inserted.
Throws:
DuplicateKeyException - thrown if a record already exists with this key.

lockRecord

public long lockRecord(long recNo)
                throws RecordNotFoundException
Locks a record so that it can only be updated or deleted by this client. Returned value is a cookie that must be used when the record is unlocked, updated, or deleted. If the specified record is already locked by a different client, the current thread gives up the CPU and consumes no CPU cycles until the record is unlocked.

Parameters:
recNo - the identifier of the record to lock.
Returns:
a cookie value that must be specified when record is unlocked.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - thrown if the record is not found in the database.

unlock

public void unlock(long recNo,
                   long cookie)
            throws java.lang.SecurityException
Releases the lock on a record. Cookie must be the cookie returned when the record was locked.

Parameters:
recNo - the identifier of the record to unlock.
cookie - the cookie this record was locked with.
Throws:
java.lang.SecurityException - thrown if the record is locked with a cookie other than lockCookie.
